{{shiremonths}}
'''Solmath''' was the second month of the [[Shire Calendar]], with thirty days approximately corresponding to modern [[22 January]] through [[20 February]].<ref name=cal>{{App|Calendars}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name represents a [[Hobbitish|modernization]] of the [[Old English]] name for February, ''[[wiktionary:solmonaþ|Solmónaþ]]'', meaning "mud-month" (cf. ''[[Wiktionary:soil#Etymology|soil]]'').<ref>{{webcite|articleurl=http://www.forodrim.org/daeron/md_smn.html|articlename=The Shire month-names|author=[[Arden R. Smith]]|website=[http://www.forodrim.org/daeron Mellonath Daeron - The Language Guild of the Forodrim]}}</ref><ref>{{HM|IE}}, Giving of Names, p. 227</ref>

In colloquial hobbitish, the month was pronounced, and sometimes spelled, ''Somath''.<ref name=cal/>
